subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The backup quarterback Ryan Perrilloux and linebacker Derrick Odom are not expected to play for No. 3 L.S.U. against No. 17 Alabama on Saturday because of their part in a nightclub brawl. Coach Les Miles said they would not practice this week. No one was arrested in the fight near the L.S.U. campus early Friday when Perrilloux and Odom got into a shoving match with a group of bouncers, a police report said. Brent McClellan, the owner of the Varsity nightclub, said Perrilloux and Odom refused to leave at the 2 a.m. closing time.
